page.title: 09FISHING IN THE ABBOTS POOL
page.content: Abbots Pool is in a small park in Failand owned by {Woodspring}district .The kind of fishing used is{coarse} fishing.This uses line, rod , and tackle.The tackle consists of floats 'shot' hooks and swimfeeders.Some people were free lining, this means no floats or shot .Abbots Pool used to be a place where people could go and get{frogspawn}and{tadpoles}.Abbots pool is very old.It was there in 1086 just before the{Domesday Book}was made .The fish in Abbots Pool are pike and other little fish like perch .The bait used to catch the fish is maggots,or live bait such as a little dace.The pool is very deep-about 10ft.at the side and 20ftin the middle.There are picnic tables and rope for children to play on and a fallen tree which is bouncy.
